intro: Ononis foetida var. submutica, commonly known as the hairy everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features dense, hairy foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
